intro: Zenkerina, commonly known as the giant water lily, is a large aquatic plant native to the Amazon Basin. It has broad, floating leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in diameter, providing habitat for various aquatic organisms. The plant's flowers are typically white or pink, opening in the early morning and closing by midday. Its roots anchor it in the mud at the bottom of water bodies, while its stems support the floating leaves. Zenkerina plays a crucial role in maintaining water quality and supporting biodiversity in its native ecosystem.
